instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no fan spin after liquid
threads.message:
hello friends, just got that board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no fan spin after liquid under the battery left side including BIl

i foud no 3.42V, a short on the coil pin 2 (pulled L6995)

injected 3.4 V and got a hot ISL <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, so green light appears, fan spins and board starts and pass all asd tests

problem is battery, no orange light with a good battery.

replaced still 2 x <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> but still the same.

<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> is good

board is not starting only with battery. have to connect battery then macsafe then fan spins then its possible to disconnect macsafe so it runs only with battery.

only with macsafe are no problems

my question, is it possible that i have a dead smc?

any suggestion for not replacing smc?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no fan spin after liquid
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light no fan spin after liquid
threads.message: replaced SMC and no problem anymore. Thanks Duke for your help.
